author: Luke Broadwater
title: Rawlings-Blake hires new CitiStat director
text:
(Michael Dresser) 
"Yes, I want to promote efficiency every single day, but I want it to be bigger than that," Rawlings-Blake said. "If we do these things, we will improve the quality of life for Baltimore residents." 
CitiStat was created under then-Mayor Martin O'Malley, a Democrat like Rawlings-Blake. Other cities have adopted the process, and O'Malley, now campaigning for the Democratic nomination for president, points to the agency's creation as a signature accomplishment of his mayoral tenure. 
Republican Gov. Larry Hogan has already done away with O'Malley's StateStat program changing it into a new unit aimed at improving performance and customer service in state government. 
Hogan issued an executive order creating the Governor's Office of Performance Improvement calling it an "important step" in his administration's effort to reduce waste and bureaucracy. His spokesman said it would take over the functions of StateStat.
